com.github.i49.hibiscus.problems

Class TypeMismatchProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.i49.hibiscus.problems.TypeMismatchProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Problem

    public class TypeMismatchProblem
extends Object
    Problem that the type of a value in JSON document does not match any types declared in the schema. Note that the type matching is done by testing the equality of TypeId which is assigned to every type.
    See Also:
    TypeId

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TypeMismatchProblem(TypeId actualType, Set<TypeId> expectedTypes)
      Constructs this problem.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String buildDescription(Locale locale)
      Builds the description of this problem.
      TypeId getActualType()
      Returns the actual type of the value found in JSON document, which does not match any types obtained by getExpectedTypes().
      String getDescription(Locale locale)
      Returns the description of this problem for specific locale.
      Set<TypeId> getExpectedTypes()
      Returns all expected types for the value, which are declared in the schema.
      JsonLocation getLocation()
      Returns the location where this problem was found including line and column numbers on the input JSON document.
      String getMessage(Locale locale)
      Returns the message of this problem for specific locale.
      Problem setLocation(JsonLocation location)
      Assigns the location where this problem was found to this problem.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this problem which has the same content as Problem.getMessage().

                           Set<TypeId> expectedTypes)
        Constructs this problem.
        Parameters:
        actualType - the actual type which caused this problem.
        expectedTypes - all expected types for the value, which are declared in the schema.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(Locale locale)
        Description copied from interface: Problem
        Returns the message of this problem for specific locale.

        This is a handy method to display this problem to the application users. The message to be returned includes both the location and the description of this problem.

        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface Problem
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale for which the message is desired. if the argument is null, default locale is used instead.
        Returns:
        the message of this problem.
